text:
```docker run -it --rm julia:1.6-buster bash
root@3756f08be78b:/# echo "main(i){for(i=0;;i++)putchar(((i*(i>>8|i>>9)&46&i>>8))^(i&i>>13|i>>6));}" | gcc -x c - && ./a.out | aplay 
bash: gcc: command not found
root@3756f08be78b:/# ```
:face_with_raised_eyebrow: Btw, the docker images were updated a couple of hours ago.

text: Ooh... I was just looking for a usable Julia + Jupyter image. I tried out QuantumObject/docker-ijulia and was just having no luck - would try to start a kernel in Jupyter, the Julia process would spin at 100% and never actually receive a result
